Html: Since pdfsharp isn't on github/bitbucket we don't have the concept of pull requests. How do we do this?

Take the source and put it on Github. The project looks dead anyway but with the MIT license you are free to do that.
Don't forget to post the link so we can find it.

Yeah. Taking on maintainance of this beast - especially in a fork without official sanction is not really something I'm gung-ho for
â€”
Sent from Mailbox
It seems someone has already put the code (without improvements) on Github already so you can fork it from him: https://github.com/DnevnikRu/PDFSharp

Yeah but that would effectively be creating a fork, wouldn't it? No guarantee, or even a pathway for making your changes land upstream. Then you quickly end up in the same nonsense as we currently have with EFHooks.
The active source (and the project is active as of this post) is on SourceForge. Looks like they abandoned Codeplex in 2012... If you want to submit a patch, looks like you need to go there...

My bad. The project looks dead because the development model is Cathedral (between releases closed to only a select set of developers) instead of a Bazaar. Looks like if you want to submit a patch, you submit a bug report, presumably with your patch as bug report support documentation.

The project is not dead.

Please use the PDFsharp forum for discussions, feedback, and to submit patches.

Please visit the PDFsharp Support Forum: http://forum.pdfsharp.net/

This is the place we check most frequently for questions and bug reports.

The PDFsharp web site is at http://www.pdfsharp.net/
